channel.title: OMFG gay number dividing thingy
channel.description:
Ok listen to this:
Sepertate the number 219 into three prats. The second number is two less than 5 times the first number, and the third number is 4 more than the first number.
Ok well confusing as hell... I usualy get these preety quick, but I am totaly stumped. Please dont call me stupid I am in only 8th grade (I go to private school) where a 90 is a B- and a 87 is a C. I am actualy excelling in this subject, but I hate math with a passion... And I can't seem to figure this damn thing out.

item.title: OMFG gay number dividing thingy
item.dc:creator: @swordskid61 Swordskid61
item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

ChaosSliver:

[quote author=xX00java00Xx link=topic=231956.msg1985013#msg1985013 date=1199777277]Sepertate the number 219 into three parts. The second number is two less than 5 times the first number, and the third number is 4 more than the first number.

x = 1st number, y = 2nd number, z = 3rd number

y = 5x - 2
z = x + 4
x + y + z = 219

since both y and z can be put into terms of x we can come up with
x + 5x - 2 + x + 4 = 219
7x + 2 = 219
7x = 217
x = 31
now we just fill in the other equations
y = 5(31) - 2 = 153
z = 31 + 4 = 35

It usually helps to explain the problem :P[/quote]
smartass 7.7 </3 math

Read full topic

item.title: OMFG gay number dividing thingy
item.dc:creator: @ChaosSliver Widget
item.description:
@ChaosSliver wrote:

xX00java00Xx:

Sepertate the number 219 into three parts. The second number is two less than 5 times the first number, and the third number is 4 more than the first number.

x = 1st number, y = 2nd number, z = 3rd number

y = 5x - 2
z = x + 4
x + y + z = 219

since both y and z can be put into terms of x we can come up with
x + 5x - 2 + x + 4 = 219
7x + 2 = 219
7x = 217
x = 31
now we just fill in the other equations
y = 5(31) - 2 = 153
z = 31 + 4 = 35

It usually helps to explain the problem

Read full topic
